column4: please see my last to comments (sent to dr_Willis by accident)
does it make it more interesting if I say the client is windows?
yes, that rules out NFS and SSHFS and leaves you with dlna (mediatomb/ushare) or samba
*IF* you get it to work, I'm 99% sure you will never get tracking correctly. streaming audio in real time between ANY computers and getting it to track to a separate video feed is nearly impossible
I got my mouse and keyboard working on two computers at once ;)
do you want ALL audio to be streamed, or just some applications?
what is the physical distance between them?
I think the easiest method would be to go to the dollar store and by a $8 male-male audio cable and hook the linux machine's line out to the windows machine's line-in :D
that will also eliminate lagg due to buffering!
yes. alteratively, you could buy a mixer, but that will probably cost more
make sure you use the line-in and not the microphone port!
nothing like solving a software problem with hardware :D
